headline.main: Goromaru Dropped From Reds Squad for Crusaders Clash
headline.print_headline: Goromaru Dropped From Reds Squad for Crusaders Clash

docs.snippet: Japan fullback Ayumu Goromaru has been dropped by the Queensland Reds for their clash with the Canterbury Crusaders on Friday, the first time the World Cup hero has been dumped from the matchday squad in a humbling debut season in Super Rugby....
docs.lead_paragraph: Japan fullback Ayumu Goromaru has been dropped by the Queensland Reds for their clash with the Canterbury Crusaders on Friday, the first time the World Cup hero has been dumped from the matchday squad in a humbling debut season in Super Rugby.

headline.main: China April Services Sector Expansion Slows, Employment Rebounds-Caixin PMI
headline.print_headline: China April Services Sector Expansion Slows, Employment Rebounds-Caixin PMI

docs.snippet: Activity in China's service sector expanded again in April, though the gains were slightly less robust than in March, a private survey showed on Thursday, as firms resumed adding staff after a rare decline the previous month....
docs.lead_paragraph: Activity in China's service sector expanded again in April, though the gains were slightly less robust than in March, a private survey showed on Thursday, as firms resumed adding staff after a rare decline the previous month.

headline.main: US Gov't Says North Carolina LGBT Law Violates Civil Rights
headline.print_headline: US Gov't Says North Carolina LGBT Law Violates Civil Rights

docs.snippet: Legislation has been proposed in states across the country to protect those who — due to religious beliefs — decline to employ or serve certain people. Critics say the laws are aimed at the LGBT community and are discriminatory. Recent...
docs.lead_paragraph: Legislation has been proposed in states across the country to protect those who — due to religious beliefs — decline to employ or serve certain people. Critics say the laws are aimed at the LGBT community and are discriminatory. Recent laws denounced as discriminatory in North Carolina and Mississippi has prompted a growing backlash from opponents. The US Justice Department said Wednesday that North Carolina's law limiting protections for LGBT people violates federal civil rights laws. North Carolina Gov. Pat McCrory says the Obama administration's warning means the issue is no longer confined to North Carolina and could affect other states. Here's a look at legislation around the country:

headline.main: Ex-Officer in San Francisco Text Scandal Pleads Not Guilty to Unrelated Charges
headline.print_headline: Ex-Officer in San Francisco Text Scandal Pleads Not Guilty to Unrelated Charges

docs.snippet: A former San Francisco police officer embroiled in a scandal over racist and homophobic text messages pleaded not guilty on Tuesday to charges he unlawfully accessed records from the Department of Motor Vehicles, prosecutors said....
docs.lead_paragraph: A former San Francisco police officer embroiled in a scandal over racist and homophobic text messages pleaded not guilty on Tuesday to charges he unlawfully accessed records from the Department of Motor Vehicles, prosecutors said.
